triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The calculated Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum LTV of 90% for Tier A applicants. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which exceeds this limit.

triageFlags.title: Loan-to-Value Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Loan-to-Value ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to meet the LTV policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, the maximum LTV for Tier A is 90%. The calculated LTV for this proposal is 91.11%, which exceeds the limit.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Policy Limit
triageFlags.description: The Debt-to-Income ratio exceeds the maximum allowed for the applicant's credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider reducing the loan amount or increasing the deposit to lower the DTI ratio.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy states that the maximum DTI for Tier A is 45%. The calculated DTI for this proposal is 45.83%, which is above the threshold.

content.reasoning: The proposal was analyzed against the underwriting policy. The applicant's credit score places them in Tier A, which allows for a maximum Loan-to-Value (LTV) of 90% and a Debt-to-Income (DTI) ratio of 45%. The calculated LTV is 91.11%, exceeding the policy limit, and the DTI is 45.83%, also above the allowed threshold. These findings indicate a need for adjustments to the loan structure to comply with policy.
